intro: Senecio toxotis, commonly known as the toxic senecio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellowish to reddish flowers that bloom in late summer to early autumn. Senecio toxotis is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It contains toxic compounds, making it potentially harmful to livestock and humans if ingested.
